listitem.para: Creates a button control. A button control lets the user trigger events. The only function of the button control is to execute the callback instruction list when it is pressed.
The parent input is the name of the window that will own the new button.
The name input identifies the new button and MUST be a unique word.
The label input is a word that will be written on the button.
The xpos input is the X coordinate where the upper left-hand corner of the new button is placed.
The ypos input is the Y coordinate where the upper left-hand corner of the new button is placed.
The width input is the width of the new button, in pixels.
The height input is the height of the new button, in pixels.
The callback input is an instruction list that is run whenever the user clicks on the button.

programlisting.userinput:
; create a button in a new window: WINDOWCREATE "main "mywindow "mytitle 0 0 100 100 [] BUTTONCREATE "mywindow "myleft "Left 25 25 25 25 [FORWARD 2 LEFT 1] BUTTONCREATE "mywindow "myright "Right 50 25 25 25 [FORWARD 2 RIGHT 1] click left or right repeatedly and watch the turtle WINDOWDELETE "mywindow
; create a button on graphics window: BUTTONCREATE "main "myleft "Left 50 50 50 25 [FORWARD 2 LEFT 1] BUTTONCREATE "main "myright "Right 100 50 50 25 [FORWARD 2 RIGHT 1] click left or right repeatedly and watch the turtle WINDOWDELETE "main
